text: hi my name is Andrew grant and I'm chief
executive of Aylesbury Vale district
council in Aylesbury Vale we have about
two hundred thousand population that's
made up about seventy-five thousand
households our mission is to allow our
residents businesses to have a great
life in our district the way we looked
at cloud was that it matched our effort
to become customer first that allowed us
to get be free to serve customers in in
the modern way not locked into your
office to your desk to be where your
customers are and to allow your staff to
work in the field to work at home to
work in the office and that seemed to me
a very sensible thing to do the
challenges we faced with the previous
environment was that we were very
internally focused and what we were
trying to do is turn ourselves inside
out so that we were all about customer
fulfillment without cloud our business
model would have been locked in the past
locked with legacy software the way that
the legacy providers wanted you to use
their services and not at the pace of
the customer using the data processing
power of AWS to understand data better
to predict when customers want us and to
then take our scarce resources in a very
difficult financial climate and target
them to where we need working with AWS
is is a great experience because it's a
collaborative effort with us all I mean
I think they feel part of the mission
and they're bringing to the table skill
sets that helped us get to where we need
to be
you
